name: Generic PETG @Tronxy X5SA
filament_start_gcode:
; Filament: PETG
; Pressure Advance: Tune with Klipper (start ~0.055 for direct drive PETG)
; SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=0.055
filament_notes:
Generic PETG profile for Tronxy X5SA with Klipper

Print Temperature: 240-245°C (adjust based on brand)
Bed Temperature: 80-85°C
Cooling: Minimal cooling - 20-50% max to prevent warping

Retraction Settings (Firmware Controlled):
- Distance: 1.2mm (slightly more than PLA, update in Klipper firmware_retraction)
- Speed: 35mm/s (slower than PLA to reduce stringing)
- Z-hop: 0.2mm
- Update Klipper config: SET_RETRACTION RETRACT_LENGTH=1.2 RETRACT_SPEED=35

Pressure Advance:
- Start with 0.055 for direct drive (PETG typically needs more than PLA)
- Fine-tune using Klipper calibration
- Add to filament_start_gcode: SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=0.055

Speed Guidelines:
- Perimeters: 40-60 mm/s (slower than PLA for better layer adhesion)
- Infill: 80-120 mm/s
- First layer: 25 mm/s (slower for better bed adhesion)
- Overhangs: 25-35 mm/s

Cooling Strategy:
- PETG is sensitive to cooling - too much causes warping/delamination
- Keep fan OFF for first 3 layers to ensure bed adhesion
- Max fan speed: 50% (only use for bridging/overhangs)
- For overhangs >50°: increase to 80-100% locally

Flow Calibration:
- Start with 98% flow ratio (PETG often over-extrudes slightly)
- Calibrate per brand using flow calibration cube

Tips:
- PETG is hygroscopic - MUST be dry (store with desiccant)
- Clean bed with IPA before printing
- Let bed cool before removing parts (PETG bonds strongly when hot)
- Use glue stick or PEI sheet for best adhesion
- First layer: aim for ~85°C bed temp for strong adhesion
- Stringing: if excessive, increase retraction to 1.5mm or reduce temp 5°C
